pullrequest.title: List parsing stages for sdf 1.4 and 1.5 models

content.raw:
Hm… Mayhaps my complaint then is that the tense is mixed, and I’m not sure why. Currently, they look like both imperative \+ indicative, rather than purely indicative, or purely imperative?

Suggestions to make purely indicative:

“Parse model files \[…\]” → “The model files are parsed from XML into a tree \[…\]”

“Check that name attributes \[…\]” → “The names attributes are checked: they should not be empty, and sibiling \[…\]”

“Check that the parent \[…\]” → “The parent and child link names are checked to be different \[…\]”

etc.

‌

That being said, feel free to just punt.
content.html:
Hm… Mayhaps my complaint then is that the tense is mixed, and I’m not sure why. Currently, they look like both imperative + indicative, rather than purely indicative, or purely imperative?

Suggestions to make purely indicative:

“Parse model files […]” → “The model files are parsed from XML into a tree […]”

“Check that name attributes […]” → “The names attributes are checked: they should not be empty, and sibiling […]”

“Check that the parent […]” → “The parent and child link names are checked to be different […]”

etc.

‌

That being said, feel free to just punt.
